discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
Actually, I'm mistaken, ... `AC` refers to commutativity modulo associativity... and in your case, it does both associativity and commutativity... the corresponding statement should in fact be: 
```
addnBAC m n p : n <= m -> m - n + p = m + p - n.
```

discussion.author: CohenCyril
discussion.comment:
For completeness, I suggest to add the following three lemmas:
```
Lemma addnBAC m n p : n <= m -> m - n + p = m + p - n.
Proof. by move=> le_nm; rewrite addnC addnBA // addnC. Qed.

Lemma addnBCA m n p : p <= m -> p <= n -> m + (n - p) = n + (m - p).
Proof. by move=> le_pm le_pn; rewrite !addnBA // addnC. Qed.

Lemma addnABC m n p : p <= m -> p <= n -> m + (n - p) = m - p + n.
Proof. by move=> le_pm le_pn; rewrite addnBA // addnBAC. Qed.
```
(I'm still unsure about the name of the last one)

discussion.comment: Thanks a lot @CohenCyril! I wasn't really sure about the name. I just force-pushed the changes you proposed.
